title: Kerning error?
content:
I was browsing this site: https://www.masteringemacs.org/article/why-emacs-has-buffers

And I think I'm looking at a kerning rendering error? The double f in the word buffer looks wrong. If it had not been word broken, hyphenated, and the second f moved to the next line, then the ffs would be rendered extra close together such that they slightly overlap. It looks like this was done, THEN the second f was moved to the next line, and so it has a dangling bit of the first f on it, which looks very out of place since the other f is on the previous line. The kerning should not be performed when the fs are split like this.

Am I characterizing this correctly, and how best to report this?
creator: psusi

title: google search does not work in firefox, but it works on waterfox!
content:
I am using waterfox G6.0.5 ()64bit), that seems to work, but I would prefer firefox 115, that was working OK until a week ago..

I get this message If I search using google

Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to www.google.com. 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem.

link to https://support.mozilla.org/1/firefox/115.3.1/WINNT/en-US/connection-not-secure

the above has no error code, and the link seems unresponsive..

I am using the latest Palemoon browser, and have no problem with youtube or other google services.. (use 'whatismybrowser' to find the 'user string'..)

palemoon.org = Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:102.0) Gecko/20100101 Goanna/6.3 Firefox/102.0 PaleMoon/32.4.1

I also have basilisk-browser.org - that also has no problems.. Most XUL extensions compatible with Firefox 52 should work. Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:68.0) Gecko/20100101 Goanna/4.8 Firefox/68.0 Basilisk/20210927

I also have an old 'waterfox.net' that works OK... Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:91.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/91.0 Waterfox/91.4.2

title: Firefox 119.0 for Mac is not remembering speaker choice for website
content:
I log into the website simplepractice.com usually 1x/wk. for a video conference. It worked up until today.

1. When testing the connection (test links were available on the above site), the listboxes for camera, microphone, and speaker, usually display all the devices attached to my Mac.

2. Today, the listbox for speakers were BLANK. Before invoking Firefox, I had set the system defaults in System Preferences->sound to the defaults I wanted.

3. The microphone and camera worked as expected.

4. I was unable to select the speaker (listbox was blank) and we ended up using cell phones on either end for the audio).

5. Repeating the test on Safari, everything (including the speaker selection) worked as expected.

6. Back on Firefox, when I went to Preferences->Permissions->microphone AND Preferences->Permissions->Camera: The saved devices appeared (for zoom and simplepractice.) BUT in: Preferences->Permissions->Speaker, zoom appeared, but simplepractice.com did not.

7. In desperation, I edited permissions.sqlite (with DB Browser for SqlLite.app) and added the missing speaker permission for simplepractice.com. (The actual site for the conference is on video.simplepractice.com)

Hopefully, when I have my conference next Wednesday, this hack will work.) The item I added to permissions.sqlite now appears in the speaker permissions window.

9. NOTE: I tried all the usual GUI interface tools before resorting to editing permissions.squlite.

8. Any idea why Firefox failed/is failing to add items to speaker permissions?
creator: jeffb4

title: Weird text in firefox fixes itself when firefox is turned off
content: Firefox displays weird characters in text when some pages are loaded. This appears to happen with Helvetica font and maybe some others. The problem seems to go away when firefox is launched in safe mode, and does not occur in other browsers. After a little digging I found when I turn hardware acceleration off the problem seems to fix itself. I'd rather not operate firefox with this option off, and I have a relatively new mac so this shouldn't be an issue. Is there a better way to solve this problem? Attached are pictures of the issue when hardware acceleration is on. As you can see, there are weird characters that display on the right.
creator: bradenbouwman
